summary: This document is a series of emails from April 2019 among staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) coordinating travel arrangements for prosecutors to travel to Florida for the case United States v. Epstein. The travel is for meetings and interviews related to the investigation into the enticement of minors for sexual activity.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.role: Legal Assistant, Public Corruption, U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY)
persons.context: Coordinates travel arrangements for prosecutors, requests to be added as the travel arranger in the E2 system.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Informs team about travel procedures, provides links for lodging and per diem rates, and requests copies of travel confirmations.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Approves travel requests for prosecutors working on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Alison
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney (likely), Southern District of New York
persons.context: One of the prosecutors traveling to Florida for meetings and interviews in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Alex
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The primary author requesting travel approval for himself and Alison to conduct case work in Florida.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case 'United States v. Epstein' for enticement of minors for sexual activity.

connections.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys traveling together to Florida to work on the Epstein case.
Alex requests and receives travel approval from Edward Tyrrell.
Darlene Alleyne, a legal assistant, is coordinating travel arrangements for Alison.
Michele Duncan informs Darlene Alleyne about the travel plans for the prosecutors.
Alex is a prosecutor working on the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: SDNY Prosecutors' Travel to Florida for Epstein Case
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys Alex and Alison travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days to conduct meetings and interviews related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Travel Approval for Epstein Case Work
events.description: Edward Tyrrell approves a travel request from Alex for himself and Alison to travel to Florida the following week for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Case
events.description: Alex submits an initial travel request for himself and an unnamed colleague (likely Alison) to travel to Florida for two days of meetings and interviews for the Epstein case.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY) - U.S. Attorney's Office
keyFacts: In April 2019, federal prosecutors from the SDNY were actively traveling to Florida to conduct interviews and meetings for the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case: United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618).
The case is explicitly described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
The travel coordination reveals the operational logistics and internal approval processes within the U.S. Attorney's Office for a high-profile case.

The emails show specific individuals involved in the prosecution team: Assistant U.S. Attorneys 'Alex' and 'Alison,' along with support staff Darlene Alleyne, Michele Duncan, and approver Edward Tyrrell.
The planned travel duration was approximately three days, from April 9 to April 12, 2019, indicating active investigative work nearly a year after Epstein's 2018 arrest.
